meanings.definition: A firm decision to do or not to do something.
meanings.sent1: My New Year's resolutions include exercising more and eating healthier.
meanings.sent2: She made a list of resolutions to improve her time management skills.
meanings.sent3: His resolution to wake up early lasted only one day.
meanings.sent4: The resolution to quit smoking was a tough challenge for him.
meanings.sent5: Setting clear resolutions helps in achieving personal goals.

meanings.definition: The action of solving a problem, dispute, or contentious matter.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful resolution of the conflict brought relief to both parties.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to find a resolution to the issue at hand.
meanings.sent3: Their resolution to decide the matter through a dance-off was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The resolution of the puzzle required careful attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The swift resolution of the case impressed everyone involved.

meanings.definition: The quality of being determined or resolute.
meanings.sent1: Her resolution to succeed in her studies was unwavering.
meanings.sent2: His resolution to overcome his fears inspired others around him.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed great resolution in catching the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The mountain climber's resolution to reach the summit was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The resolution in her eyes showed her strong determination.

meanings.definition: The process of reducing or separating something into its components.
meanings.sent1: The resolution of the mixture into its individual substances was complex.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use various techniques for the resolution of chemical compounds.
meanings.sent3: The resolution of the painting revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent4: The resolution of the data into categories made analysis easier.
meanings.sent5: The microscope allowed for the resolution of tiny particles.
